channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-8209] Improve LoadTest extensibility
item.description:
This patch rolls up related changes:

  • Allow classes extending TestMiniClusterLoadSequential to override how reader and writer threads are set up, including extending the reader and writers themselves.
  • Make it so classes extending MultiThreadedWriter can cleanly override how Puts are constructed.
  • Provide an option for passing in a custom table descriptor to HBaseTestingUtility#createPreSplitLoadTestTable.
  • HBaseTestingUtility#waitUntilAllRegionsAssigned does not check if the region it is counting belongs to the table created by the test and will not return if it accidentally counts "too many" regions, for example the regions of the ACL table when security is enabled. (Some class based on TestMiniClusterLoadSequential may want to enable security.)

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Sound good to me overall.

should there be a timeout setup in waitUntilAllRegionsAssigned in case a region is stuck and never been assigned?

Looking at the patch against trunk:

+          for (Result r = null; (r = s.next()) != null;) {

+            byte[] b = r.getValue(HConstants.CATALOG_FAMILY, HConstants.REGIONINFO_QUALIFIER);

+            if (b == null || b.length <= 0) {

+              break;

+            }

Why do you want a break instead of continue? Doesn't this drop potential records on the floor?

Also, your non-standard for-loop control arguments caught me off-guard

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12575813/HBASE-8209-0.94.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 27 new or modified tests.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/5033//console

This message is automatically generated.

should there be a timeout setup in waitUntilAllRegionsAssigned in case a region is stuck and never been assigned?

Seems reasonable, will add.

Why do you want a break instead of continue? Doesn't this drop potential records on the floor?

Thanks, paste-o.
This currently 'works', but in the sense of the original code I guess.

Also, your non-standard for-loop control arguments caught me off-guard

Just carried over from nearby code.

*-v2 patches address comments and add a hardcoded 30 second timeout to waitUntilAllRegionsAssigned. Tested all unit tests which use this locally with 0.94. I'm not a fan of waitUntilAllRegionsAssigned but the aim of this JIRA isn't to replace it, just to fix a bug there impacting subclasses of LoadTest which may enable security.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12575982/HBASE-8209-0.94-v2.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 27 new or modified tests.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/5042//console

This message is automatically generated.
Will commit tomorrow with HBASE-8210 if no objection.
v3 patch throws an exception if waitUntilAllRegionsAssigned times out.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12576014/HBASE-8209-0.94-v3.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 27 new or modified tests.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/5043//console

This message is automatically generated.

Applied to trunk and 0.94 so far, about to apply to 0.95 now that it's building. Looks like I need an addendum, TestMasterTransitions doesn't like the timeout added in waitUntilAllRegionsAssigned. I regret adding it because waitUntilAllRegionsAssigned isn't the focus of this issue at all. Going to back that part out specifically.
Attached addendums which revert the changes to HBaseTestingUtility#waitUntilAllRegionsAssigned. Will follow up there on HBASE-8226.

Integrated in HBase-TRUNK-on-Hadoop-2.0.0 #468 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-TRUNK-on-Hadoop-2.0.0/468/)
Amend HBASE-8209. Revert changes to HBaseTestingUtility#waitUntilAllRegionsAssigned (Revision 1462639)
HBASE-8209. Improve LoadTest extensibility (Revision 1462611)

Result = FAILURE
